Class Flush

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardList
      • Hand
        • Flush
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Flush
extends Hand
    Flush class is a subclass of Hand which is used to model a Flush hand with methods to check if the hand is a valid Flush type, and also return the top card of the hand if it is a valid Flush
    Author:
    Rishabh
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Flush​(CardGamePlayer player, CardList cards)
      This constructor helps creating a Flush object holding the flush hand of specific player and cards played by that player

      • Flush

        public Flush​(CardGamePlayer player,
             CardList cards)
        This constructor helps creating a Flush object holding the flush hand of specific player and cards played by that player
        Parameters:
        player - CardGamePlayer object containing specified player with the current hand
        cards - CardList object containing list of cards being played by the active player
